page.title: 07Goldmire Quarry,Dalton cont.
page.content: first crusher and then on a conveyor belt.From there it is washed and sorted to remove the clay and spar rock and transported to more crushers and conveyors where it is sorted and crushed futher.At the end of the process stone sizes range from 5mm to 40mm.Most of the rock is used to make concrete,bricks and tarmac.The mixture for concrete is one measure of cement and 10 of limestone dust.A small amount of water is added then it is delivered to the customer. The bricks are made from a mixture of limestone and granite squashed under 45 tonnes of pressure.The bricks are stacked in piles of 400 with gaps so a fork-lift truck can easily carry them. They are dried naturally.Upto 1.5 million can be stored at once.The tarmac is made from limestone,granite and bitumen heated together.
